warning.linux: If you have never used Pybricks with USB on Linux, you will need to configure udev rules before you can install the firmware.
warning.windows: If you have never used Pybricks with USB on Windows, you may need to manually install a USB driver before you can flash the hub firmware.

prepare.batteries: Make sure the hub has fresh batteries.
prepare.turnOff: Make sure the hub is turned off.
prepare.app: Open the {lego} PoweredUp app in 'Create' mode and start a new project.

step.disconnectIo: Disconnect any device from port A on the hub.
step.holdButton: Press and hold the {button} on the hub.
step.waitForLight: Wait for the {light} to start blinking {lightPattern}.
step.waitAppConnect: The app will automatically connect and start restoring the firmware.

connect.selectDevice: In the pop-up dialog, select {deviceName} and click {connectButton}.
